content.question: A rectangle has its upper two vertices on the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 12 minus the fraction x squared over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and its lower two vertices on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. What is the maximum possible area of the rectangle?

choices.label: <math alttext="216 minus, 72 times the square root of 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>216</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>72</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="32 times the square root 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="32 times the square root 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
